question: Which statue was declared the world's largest bust by the Guinness Book of World Records?
explanation: The 112 feet tall bust of 'Adiyogi' Lord Shiva has been declared the world's largest bust by the Guinness Book of World Records. Isha Foundation led by Guru Jaggi Vasudev had set up the Adiyogi bust which refers to source of Yoga and symbolises the 112 methods of self-transformation that the first Yogi or Adiyogi.
